head.title: Fatal Crashes Surged For Explorers in '99

hedline.hl1: Fatal Crashes Surged For Explorers in '99

block.p: The number of fatal accidents involving Ford Explorers with tire problems more than doubled last year, an analysis of fatal accidents across the country shows.

Meanwhile, Ford and another tire maker, Continental, are preparing to replace tires on roughly 40,000 Lincoln Navigator sport utility vehicles, although there have been no reports of serious accidents involving the tires.

Meanwhile, Ford and another tire maker, Continental, are preparing to replace tires on roughly 40,000 Lincoln Navigator sport utility vehicles, although there have been no reports of serious accidents involving the tires.

The high number of sport utility vehicles that have rolled over because of defective Firestone tires has splintered the auto industry's once-monolithic resistance to federal ratings of new models' tendency to roll over, increasing the odds that such ratings will be imposed.
Business Day, Pages C1 and C16.
